meanings.definition: To pile up or accumulate in a heap.
meanings.sent1: She uppiled the books neatly on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The leaves uppiled in the corner of the garden.
meanings.sent3: He uppiled the toys so high, they almost touched the ceiling!
meanings.sent4: The work uppiled on her desk like a mountain of papers.
meanings.sent5: The sand uppiled at the beach formed a small dune.

meanings.definition: To increase in quantity or amount.
meanings.sent1: They uppiled the snacks for the party.
meanings.sent2: Her savings uppiled slowly over time.
meanings.sent3: The laughter uppiled in the room as the jokes got funnier.
meanings.sent4: His responsibilities uppiled like a stack of heavy bricks.
meanings.sent5: The excitement uppiled as the concert drew closer.
